title: Al-Shafi'i School for Child Welfare Project – Boys' Section
description: Orphaned children in the primary education phase
fullDescription: Al-Shafi'i School for Child Welfare (Boys' Section) was launched in the city of Atarib in 2015 as a specialized educational and humanitarian initiative focused on the academic, psychological, and social care and rehabilitation of **orphaned children** and **children of martyrs**. The school operates within a renovated governmental building and currently hosts over **700 students**, supervised by an educational and administrative staff of approximately 36 employees. The school provides a **safe, integrated educational environment** that addresses the academic, psychological, and values-based development of the child.
importance: This project is a pioneering initiative to support orphaned children in conflict environments, promoting their **educational attainment** and **social integration**. It provides a safe pedagogical environment that mitigates the effects of war and deprivation.
importanceList: The project has contributed to raising the level of academic attainment and enhancing value-based behavior among children, especially orphans.
It provided a supportive educational environment that alleviated the effects of loss and deprivation resulting from the war conditions.
It worked to enhance the children's integration into the community through comprehensive and supportive activities.
It represented a successful model for humanitarian education in long-term conflict-affected environments.

components.title: • Academic Education and Rehabilitation:
components.description: A flexible official curriculum that accounts for individual differences, the development of collective and individual remedial plans, and the strengthening of the educational relationship between teachers and students in a supportive learning environment.

components.title: • Health and Nutritional Care:
components.description: Providing nutritious meals, organizing periodic medical examinations, conducting health awareness sessions, and maintaining a clean and safe environment that promotes physical and psychological health.

components.title: • Psychological Support and Protection:
components.description: Individual and group psychological support sessions supervised by specialists, training for teachers, and creating an environment free of violence and discrimination, providing safety and support for children.

components.title: • Behavioral Education and Value Inculcation:
components.description: Interactive educational programs that promote positive behavior and self-discipline, and extracurricular activities that instill moral values and enhance social responsibility.

components.title: • Skills and Educational Activities:
components.description: Organizing artistic, agricultural, and sports activities, along with holding periodic exhibitions and festivals to showcase students' talents and develop their spirit of initiative.

components.title: • Logistics Support:
components.description: Providing free transportation for orphaned children, securing school supplies, providing clothing and heating, and conducting periodic maintenance of facilities to ensure the sustainability of the school environment.

partners: The Islamic Community of Bosnia and Herzegovina (Bosnian Islamic Authority)
objectives: Provide quality and safe education for orphaned male children and children of martyrs.
Bridge the educational gap through remedial programs that consider the psychological and educational state of the orphan.
Support the psychological and social growth of children and help them overcome the effects of trauma.
Develop moral values and behavioral discipline among students.
Discover and refine children's talents in various fields.
Stimulate community interaction and expand the local support network for orphan care.
